alert.note: Alert for North Snowy Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 27 at 1:21AM MST until January 27 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph. * WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills, including Arlington and Elk Mountain along Interstate 80 between Laramie and Rawlins. * WHEN...Until 8 PM MST this evening. Periods of heavy snow are likely to persist into Saturday. * IMPACTS...Extremely dangerous or impossible travel conditions due to icy, snow packed roads and near zero visibilities in falling and blowing snow.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
